entry.title: How to use Jenkins Docker Cloud
entry.summary:
Recently, I am working on Jenkins instance migration, this time I started to use Jenkins Docker Cloud insead of use docker { ... } in Jenkinsfile.

Jenkins cloud plugin

First you need to install Jenkins Docker Cloud plugin https://plugins.jenkins.io/docker-plugin/

Jenkins Docker Cloud is a plugin that allows Jenkins to use Docker containers as build agents.

So you need to config a Docker Host with remote API as follows.

entry.title: What Optimizations I Made During the Jenkins Upgrade
entry.summary:
Background

Recently, Iâ€™ve been working on migrating and upgrading Jenkins. The main motivation is the vulnerability CVE-2024-23897.

Jenkins 2.441 and earlier, LTS 2.426.2 and earlier does not disable a feature of its CLI command parser that replaces an â€˜@â€™ character followed by a file path in an argument with the fileâ€™s contents, allowing unauthenticated attackers to read arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.

To address this, Jenkins needs to be upgraded to at least version 2.442 or LTS 2.426.3 or above. This was also an opportunity to rework parts of the setup that werenâ€™t initially optimized.

entry.title: Conventional Branch Specification Released!
entry.summary:
Summary

Conventional Branch refers to a structured and standardized naming convention for Git branches which aims to make branch more readable and actionable. Weâ€™ve suggested some branch prefixes you might want to use but you can also specify your own naming convention. A consistent naming convention makes it easier to identify branches by type.
